entries.name: TopTournament
entries.description: Represents the entry point and highest level of a dispute in PRT. Disagreeing validators join this tournament to resolve conflicts over the entire computation trace through a bisection game.

entries.name: BottomTournament
entries.description: Referees the dispute over a single contested Cartesi machine step as the final stage of arbitration in a dispute. It calls the CartesiStateTransition contract to get a definitive on-chain ruling and identify the winner.

entries.name: Application
entries.description: Main dApp contract that escrows assets and executes the verified results (outputs) from off-chain computation. It relies on the eth:0x6CE590b9F0697327f18c601DF6f0baE4a0801B68 contract to validate outputs before releasing assets or triggering on-chain actions. The immutable template hash of the dApp is `0x615acc9fb8ae058d0e45c0d12fa10e1a6c9e645222c6fd94dfeda194ee427c14`.

receivedPermissions.description: withdraw the entire balance in the escrow.

entries.name: DaveConsensus
entries.description: Contract managing PRT fraud-proof tournaments, managing application epochs and input validation, as well as settlement and challenge periods. Dispute tournaments are started here and the final, verified computation result (as an `outputsMerkleRoot`) is recorded when they are resolved.

entries.name: CartesiStateTransition
entries.description: Onchain verifier that can execute a single, disputed instruction of the Cartesi machine. It is the ultimate arbiter that BottomTournament calls to determine which party's claimed state transition is correct.

entries.name: MultiLevelTournamentFactory
entries.description: Responsible for creating and orchestrating the multi-stage dispute process. It instantiates the correct tournament contract (Top, Middle, or Bottom) depending on the current stage of the dispute game.

entries.name: InputBox
entries.description: Serves as both the canonical log for arbitrary dApp inputs and a portal for depositing assets (one possible type of input). It ensures data availability and that all off-chain participants process the same inputs in the same order.

entries.name: ERC20Portal
entries.description: Contract that allows anyone to perform transfers of ERC-20 tokens to Cartesi DApps.

entries.name: CanonicalTournamentParametersProvider
entries.description: Provides constant configuration data for the tournament system. It defines parameters like the number of levels (3), the minimum challenge period of ~7d, and the size of computation segments at each stage of a dispute.

topTournamentParameters.description: levels: number of levels for the tournament, maxAllowance: minimum challenge period in L1 blocks, log2step: sparsity of the machine hash (every 2^x cycles), height: height of the machine hash merkle tree, matchEffort: time bonus in L1 blocks granted to participants when they enter a match.

entries.name: MiddleTournament
entries.description: Handles the intermediate stages of a dispute following the TopTournament targeting a more granular bisection game.
